key_points: Prince Harry and Meghan named their daughter Lilibet Diana, born in Santa Barbara, California.
Lilibet's name pays homage to Queen Elizabeth ('Lilibet' was her childhood nickname) and Harry's late mother, Princess Diana.
Lilibet Diana Mountbatten-Windsor weighed 7 pounds, 11 ounces at birth; both she and Meghan are healthy and well.
Harry and Meghan asked that, in lieu of gifts, well-wishers support charities dedicated to improving the lives of women and girls.
Both Harry and Meghan will take parental leave from their work at the Archewell Foundation.
Lilibet is likely to be Harry and Meghan's last child, citing environmental concerns.
Lilibet is the Sussexes' second child and is eighth in line to the British throne.
Lilibet's arrival was announced after Meghan suffered a miscarriage in 2020, which Meghan shared in a New York Times op-ed.
Harry and Meghan stepped down as working members of the royal family in 2020 and have since aired grievances in a high-profile interview with Oprah.
Archie and Lilibet are the only biracial members of the British royal family.
